content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Haoyu Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Hello Haoyu Wang, glad to meet you. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Considering the prime location and modern features of this apartment, my initial offer for the rental price is 650 Euros per month. However, as a student with a responsible nature, I hope we can reach a more affordable agreement. I'm willing to negotiate.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because I think your offer of 650 Euros is too low given the prime location and modern features of the apartment. I am looking for a higher price. Let's see if we can reach a higher agreement.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Understood but somewhat disappointed. However, I'm open to finding a mutual acceptable price. Could you please propose a higher rental figure while considering its exceptional location and amenities?
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Considering the exceptional location and amenities of the apartment, I propose a rental price of 1000 Euros per month. I believe this price reflects the value of the apartment.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Your suggested rental price of 1000 Euros is significantly higher than my initial offer. While I understand the apartment has desirable features, I must ensure it remains affordable for my budget as a student. Could we meet halfway at around 800 Euros per month? This would be a fair compromise.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because your offer of 800 Euros is still too low for me. I am looking for a higher price. I believe the apartment is worth more than what you are offering. Let's see if we can reach a higher agreement.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Note taken but regrettable. It seems like our gaps in expectations remain wide. Should additional conditions or benefits come into play, such as a longer lease term or covering utility costs, would you consider adjusting the rental price? This could help us reach a mutually beneficial agreement.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because I am not willing to discuss additional conditions or benefits at the moment. I am only interested in discussing the rental price. Let's see if we can reach an agreement on the price first.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Understood and respecting your focus on rental price alone at this stage. Let me summarize our current stance: I stand firm at 1000 Euros while you insist on a higher price. If no common ground emerges over the rental figure, our negotiation will come to an end.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: That's correct. We have not agreed on a price yet. If we cannot reach an agreement on the rental price, the negotiation will be terminated. Let's see if we can find a price that works for both of us.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany
